body: From what I see in the error message, something's wrong with your GPU driver.

Hum ok, i made un update of my drivers, video2x worked before i made it.
I installed GeForce Game Ready Driver, version 445.87.
Do you have to make an update of your software or i have to change my drivers?
Try rebooting first, it might be a temporary issue.

I tried again after rebooting, but i still have an error upcaling.
![Error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65050591/81624295-17dfc400-93f6-11ea-950b-87dc4cd40e9b.png)

Should i reinstal Drivers?

I cut the video, i'll be more reactive now.

I tried to reinstal, reboot and made multiple tests with differents versions of video2x but it can't upscale.
I don't know if the issue comes from the installation of my drivers or my attempt to install CUDA.
You don't seem to be using cuDNN, but it seems like it's warning you about something related to a cuDNN failure. If it still doesn't work for you, maybe try another driver.

i tried it with 3 differents Drivers for my configuration (GTX1660), recommanded/Certified versions but it does not work.
I don't know what to do, i think i made something wrong following with guide https://docs.nvidia.com/deeplearning/sdk/cudnn-install/index.html#install-windows

Is it possible it cause the issue?

God damn, i finally found what was the problem.
It effectively was an issue when i tried to follow the guide.
I followed this:

4.1.2. Installing The CUDA Toolkit For Windows

Refer to the following instructions for installing CUDA on Windows, including the CUDA driver and toolkit: https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-installation-guide-microsoft-windows/index.html


But it made me download a version that does not work with Video2x.
In the CUDA directory path C:\Program Files\NVIDIA GPU Computing Toolkit\
i deleted the CUDA folder and replace it by an other that i downloaded here: https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn
Oh you're supposed to install CUDA kit then paste the content of the cuDNN download in to the CUDA folder. It's your installation's problem then.

Yes it was my fault.
Well, thanks a lot for your assistance, i can use waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan now.

Hello,

I am sorry but i don’t get a good video with waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan.
Could you try to use it with my 20s video test to say me if it’s me or a bug ?
https://send.firefox.com/download/24db862855aaecd1/#-7KBl1L_l5btyVtsY98pKg

I really would like to use waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan because i made tests and i saw that it takes half the time and i have many videos to upgrade.

Fania,

I've also noticed python-magic to have this bug.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21986859/81890504-a6d71280-9595-11ea-94e0-b626e1552f18.png)

Thank for the answer,

I’ll send you what i get when i do it. https://send.firefox.com/download/d3c0b72d12fe23e2/#zprUYzTzhNzxPFwnTyh_zw

I join you some error frame that i saw when i upscaled the full video (only 9 for 44000 frames)

If you say that the issue should be my configuration, i won’t make you waste more time and i will apologize for that.

Just an other question, you said that there is an option to check if the waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan is usable but i did not find the button you screened. Where is this option ?

Fania,

Looks fine at my end.

You are receiving this because you modified the open/close state.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.

I think there's something wrong with waifu2c-ncnn-vulkan itself or something wrong with your configuration. Do a simple test and upscale a single image to see if that fails.

> Just an other question, you said that there is an option to check if the waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan is usable but i did not find the button you screened. Where is this option ?

The option I talked about was for waifu2x-caffe, not ncnn-vulkan.
